detaileddescription.para:
Standard Rte is updated function Defined for the port RpEMLDiagAnpassung signal DeCoding.
reentrant No context task thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
void
. range NA. resolution factor = NA offset = NA . unit NA.
boolean FALSE the signal was not updated since the last read TRUE the signal was updated by the sender
Globals
Update counters.
Error Handling
No error handling is performed by RteLight. This has to be done by the application software Call Sequence
Verification criteria
Testcase shall check whether the function is returning TRUE or FALSE according to sender counter .
Test Method
The test technique involves: error guessing, statement testing, decision testing Tested in TEST_Rte_IsUpdated_SWC_PORT_SIGNAL
Traceability

Standard Rte result function. Format Rte_Result_Port_Operation
reentrant No context task context thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
IN/OUT
Result The signature can include zero or more IN/OUT and OUT parameters depending on the signature of the operation in the client-server interface.
Std_ReturnType - as described by the AUTOSAR specifications. range {RTE_E_OK, RTE_E_INVALID,RTE_E_MAX_AGE_EXCEEDED,RTE_E_NEVER_RECEIVED,RTE_E_OUT_OF_RANGE,RTE_E_UNCONNECTED}. resolution factor = N/A offset = N/A. unit N/A.
Globals
N/A since it is an Standard AUTOSAR API.
Call Sequence
Verification criteria
Testcase shall check the return type of the function .
Test Method
The test technique involves: error guessing, statement testing, decision testing Tested in TEST_Rte_Result_SWC_PORT_OPERATION
Traceability
This covers the generic function Rte_Result_/<SWC>_/<Port>_/<OPERATION> from architecture Satisfies following DOORS Requirements: :{SWR_ICAS1_RteLight_323}.

briefdescription.para: Contains AUTOSAR specific macros and functions used to integrate the SWC:

detaileddescription.para:
Source
Rte_SWC.h Revision
version Author
author Date
date - declaration of queue initialization

Intended to be directly included by the SWCs' files. Include own header files in the testcase file (SWATT), no stubs for data types and function prototypes. Add software requirement IDs in the testcases.
